required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of PF-06700841 in Subjects With Active Psoriatic Arthritis
clinical_study.official_title: A PHASE 2B, RANDOMIZED, DOUBLE-BLIND, PLACEBO-CONTROLLED STUDY OF PF-06700841 TO EVALUATE THE EFFICACY AT 16 WEEKS AND TO EVALUATE THE SAFETY AND EFFICACY UP TO 1 YEAR IN SUBJECTS WITH ACTIVE PSORIATIC ARTHRITIS

brief_summary.textblock: This is a 52 week Phase 2b study designed to evaluate the efficacy at 16 weeks and to evaluate the safety and efficacy up to 1 year in subjects with active psoriatic arthritis.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: The proportion of subjects achieving an ACR20 response
primary_outcome.description: The proportion of subjects achieving an American College of Rheumatology 20 (ACR20) response at Week 16.

secondary_outcome.measure: The proportion of TNF-naive subjects achieving an ACR20 response
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of subjects achieving an ACR20 response at Week 16 in the subgroup of subjects who are TNF-alpha inhibitor na√Øve.

secondary_outcome.measure: The proportion of subjects achieving an ACR20 response
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of subjects achieving an ACR20 response at all treatment timepoints except Week 16

secondary_outcome.measure: The proportion of subjects achieving an ACR50 response
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of subjects achieving an ACR50 response at all treatment timepoints

secondary_outcome.measure: The proportion of subjects achieving an ACR70 response
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of subjects achieving an ACR70 response at all treatment timepoints

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in the ACR response criteria components
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in the ACR response criteria components (Tender/painful joint count, Swollen joint count, Patient's Assessment of Arthritis Pain, Patient's Global Assessment of Arthritis, Physician's Global Assessment of Arthritis, Health Assessment Questionnaire [HAQ] disability index [DI], and hsCRP)

secondary_outcome.measure: The proportion of subjects achieving a Psoriasis Area and Severity Index 75/90/100 (PASI75/90/100) response
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of subjects achieving a Psoriasis Area and Severity Index 75/90/100 (PASI75/90/100) response at all treatment timepoints

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in the enthesitis score using the Spondyloarthritis Research Consortium of Canada [SPARCC] Enthesitis Index.
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in the enthesitis score using the Spondyloarthritis Research Consortium of Canada [SPARCC] Enthesitis Index.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in the enthesitis score using the Leeds Enthesitis Index.
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in the enthesitis score using the Leeds Enthesitis Index.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in the Dactylitis Severity Score
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in the Dactylitis Severity Score at all treatment timepoints

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in the Nail Psoriasis Severity Index (NAPSI) Score
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in the Nail Psoriasis Severity Index (NAPSI) Score at all treatment timepoints

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in the Patient's Global Joint and Skin Assessment Visual Analog Scale (PGJS VAS)
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in the Patient's Global Joint and Skin Assessment Visual Analog Scale (PGJS VAS) at all treatment timepoints. Scale will be 100 mm in length.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in the Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy Fatigue (FACIT Fatigue)
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in the Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy Fatigue (FACIT Fatigue) at all treatment timepoints

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in the Short Form 36 Health Survey (SF 36) Version 2, Acute
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in the Short Form 36 Health Survey (SF 36) Version 2, Acute, at all treatment timepoints except Week 2

secondary_outcome.measure: The proportion of subjects achieving Minimal Disease Activity (MDA) and Very Low Disease Activity (VLDA) response
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of subjects achieving Minimal Disease Activity (MDA) and Very Low Disease Activity (VLDA) response at all treatment timepoints except Week 2

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in the Disease Activity Index for Reactive Arthritis/PsA (DAREA/DAPSA)
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in the Disease Activity Index for Reactive Arthritis/PsA (DAREA/DAPSA)

secondary_outcome.measure: The proportion of subjects achieving the Psoriatic Arthritis Response Criteria (PsARC)
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of subjects achieving the Psoriatic Arthritis Response Criteria (PsARC) at all treatment timepoints except Week 2

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in the Psoriatic Arthritis Disease Activity Score (PASDAS)
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in the Psoriatic Arthritis Disease Activity Score (PASDAS) at all treatment timepoints except Week 2

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
Number of Participants Who Discontinued From the Study Due to Treatment-Emergent AEs

arm_group.description: PF-06700841 60 mg once daily for 52 weeks
PF-06700841 30 mg once daily for 52 weeks

arm_group.arm_group_label: PF-06700841 10 mg once daily followed by 60 mg once daily
arm_group.description: PF-06700841 10 mg once daily for 16 weeks, followed by 60 mg once daily until Week 52

arm_group.arm_group_label: PF-06700841 10 mg once daily followed by 30 mg once daily
arm_group.description: PF-06700841 10 mg once daily for 16 weeks, followed by 30 mg once daily until Week 52

arm_group.arm_group_label: Placebo once daily followed by 60 mg once daily
arm_group.description: Placebo once daily for 16 weeks, followed by PF-06700841 60 mg once daily until Week 52

arm_group.arm_group_label: Placebo once daily followed by 30 mg once daily
arm_group.description: Placebo once daily for 16 weeks, followed by PF-06700841 30 mg once daily until Week 52

intervention.description: Starting after the Week 16 visit, subjects receiving PF-06700841 10 mg once daily will start to randomly receive either the 60 mg QD dose or 30 mg QD dose until Week 52, as predetermined at randomization. All subjects will receive blinded dosing throughout the 52 weeks study treatment period in order to maintain the study blind.
intervention.arm_group_label: PF-06700841 10 mg once daily followed by 30 mg once daily
PF-06700841 10 mg once daily followed by 60 mg once daily

intervention.description: Starting after the Week 16 visit, subjects receiving placebo will start to randomly receive either the 60 mg QD dose or 30 mg QD dose until Week 52, as predetermined at randomization. All subjects will receive blinded dosing throughout the 52 weeks study treatment period in order to maintain the study blind.
intervention.arm_group_label: Placebo once daily followed by 30 mg once daily
Placebo once daily followed by 60 mg once daily

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Active arthritis at screening/baseline as indicated by >/= 3 tender/painful and 3 swollen joints.
- Active plaque psoriasis at screening and baseline.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Non-plaque forms of psoriasis (with exception of nail psoriasis).
- History of autoimmune rheumatic disease other than PsA; also prior history of or current, rheumatic inflammatory disease other than PsA.

reference.citation: Banfield C, Scaramozza M, Zhang W, Kieras E, Page KM, Fensome A, Vincent M, Dowty ME, Goteti K, Winkle PJ, Peeva E. The Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics, and Pharmacodynamics of a TYK2/JAK1 Inhibitor (PF-06700841) in Healthy Subjects and Patients With Plaque Psoriasis. J Clin Pharmacol. 2018 Apr;58(4):434-447. doi: 10.1002/jcph.1046. Epub 2017 Dec 21.
